meanings.definition: The central or most important part of something.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the hero's bravery was the coremium of the plot.
meanings.sent2: The coremium of the team's success was their strong teamwork.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the cake's coremium was the delicious frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the coremium of her beauty, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The coremium of the puzzle was the missing piece that completed it.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things that form the central part of something.
meanings.sent1: The coremium of the club consisted of dedicated members.
meanings.sent2: In the orchestra, the coremium played a crucial role in the performance.
meanings.sent3: The coremium of the class project worked together harmoniously.
meanings.sent4: The coremium of friends always had each other's backs.
meanings.sent5: The coremium of the collection showcased the artist's best works.

meanings.definition: To remove the core or central part from something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully coremiumed the apple before slicing it.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed to coremium the pineapple for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally coremiumed the key ingredient from the dish.
meanings.sent4: The tailor had to coremium the fabric to alter the dress.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist had to coremium the fossil from the rock for study.
